actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide individuals a credit against income tax for amounts paid for tuition at certain elementary, secondary, and vocational schools.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals an income tax credit for half of the first $6000 in tuition paid for each of their dependents at an elementary, secondary or vocational school. Reduces the maximum credit according to a progressive scale for middle and high income individuals.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide individuals a credit against income tax for amounts paid for tuition at certain elementary, secondary, and vocational schools.
